newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bank Niaga rises on share purchase news.
newsitem.headline: Bank Niaga rises on share purchase news.

text.p: Shares of Indonesia's Bank Niaga soared in early trading on Monday following an announcement that a privately-owned firm, PT Tunasmas Paduarta, planned to acquire a 50-percent stake in the bank, brokers said.
"The proposed share purchase boosted sentiment in the counter and pushed it to touch a year high of 8,000 rupiah," one broker said.
Bank Niaga rose 1,075 rupiah to close the morning session at 7,775 rupiah after touching 8,000 rupiah but the volume was thin as only 297,000 shares were traded.

Tunasmas proposes to buy about a 40 percent stake in the bank from two major shareholders and a 10 percent stake from the public at a price of 8,000 rupiah per share, Lippo Securities said in an announcement. The firm is acting as underwriter for the offer.
